Package org.example.unogame.controller

Class GameUnoController

java.lang.Object
org.example.unogame.controller.GameUnoController
public class GameUnoController extends Object
Controller for the Uno game screen. It coordinates user interactions, machine actions, game rules enforcement, and UI updates.

  • Field Details

    • turnLabel

      public javafx.scene.control.Label turnLabel

  • Constructor Details

    • GameUnoController

      public GameUnoController()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize() throws GameException
      Initializes the controller after FXML loading. Sets up the game model, applies UI effects, displays the initial table card, and starts worker threads.
      Throws:
      GameException - if initialization or game start fails

    • setAnimations

      public void setAnimations(IAnimations animations)
      Sets the animation handler used for visual effects during gameplay.
      Parameters:
      animations - an implementation of IAnimations to manage game animations

    • initmatch

      public void initmatch(GameUno game) throws GameException
      Initializes the game session based on the provided GameUno object.

      If the given game instance is null, a new game is created; otherwise, the previously saved game state is loaded.

      Parameters:
      game - the game instance to initialize, or null to start a new game
      Throws:
      GameException - if there is an error during initialization

    • newGame

      public void newGame() throws GameException
      Starts a new game session by initializing all game components, starting background threads, and updating the visual UI.
      Throws:
      GameException - if there is an error retrieving the initial table card or during setup

    • canPlayCard

      public boolean canPlayCard(Card cardPlay, Table table) throws GameException.EmptyTableException
      Determines if the provided card can be legally placed on the table over the current top card according to Uno rules.
      Parameters:
      cardPlay - the card the player wants to play
      table - the table state reference
      Returns:
      true if the move is valid; false otherwise
      Throws:
      GameException.EmptyTableException - if no card is currently on the table

    • saveGame

      public void saveGame()
      Saves the current game state to a file using serialization.

      If the save operation fails, an error message is printed to stderr.

    • loadGameState

      public void loadGameState()
      Loads a previously saved game state from file and reinitializes all necessary components including players, table, deck, and threads.

      This method also updates the UI and starts necessary background threads after loading the game state.

    • setupAutoSaveOnClose

      public void setupAutoSaveOnClose(javafx.stage.Stage stage)
      Sets up a hook to automatically save the game when the application window is closed.
      Parameters:
      stage - the primary stage of the JavaFX application

    • specialCard

      public void specialCard(Card card, Player currentPlayer, Player otherPlayer) throws GameException.EmptyTableException, GameException.IllegalCardColor, GameException.OutOfCardsInDeck, GameException.NullCardException, GameException.InvalidCardIndex
      Applies the effect of a special card and manages turn flow accordingly.
      Parameters:
      card - the played special card
      currentPlayer - the player who played the card
      otherPlayer - the opponent player
      Throws:
      GameException.EmptyTableException - if the table is empty
      GameException.IllegalCardColor - if an invalid color is applied
      GameException.OutOfCardsInDeck - if the deck runs out of cards
      GameException.NullCardException - if a null card is processed unexpectedly
      GameException.InvalidCardIndex - if a hand index is invalid

    • isSpecial

      public boolean isSpecial(String value)
      Indicates whether the provided value corresponds to a special card.
      Parameters:
      value - the card face value
      Returns:
      true if the value matches a special card; false otherwise

    • showColorPicker

      public void showColorPicker() throws GameException.InvalidCardIndex
      Shows the color selection panel and prevents card plays until a color is chosen.
      Throws:
      GameException.InvalidCardIndex - if an invalid index is accessed while wiring events

    • hideColorPicker

      public void hideColorPicker()
      Hides the color selection panel and restores layout spacing.

    • setHumanTurn

      public void setHumanTurn(boolean humanTurn) throws GameException.EmptyTableException
      Updates the internal and UI state to reflect whose turn it is.
      Parameters:
      humanTurn - true if it is the human's turn; false for the machine
      Throws:
      GameException.EmptyTableException - if updating the label requires the current table color and it is missing

    • isHumanTurn

      public boolean isHumanTurn()
      Returns:
      true if it is currently the human's turn; false otherwise

    • setWaitingForColor

      public void setWaitingForColor(boolean waiting)
      Sets whether the controller is waiting for a color selection (e.g., after playing a WILD).
      Parameters:
      waiting - true to block plays until a color is selected

    • getHumanPlayer

      public Player getHumanPlayer()
      Returns:
      the human player reference

    • getMachinePlayer

      public Player getMachinePlayer()
      Returns:
      the machine player reference

    • setHumanCanSayONE

      public void setHumanCanSayONE(boolean humanCanSayONE)
      Configures if the human is allowed to call "UNO".
      Parameters:
      humanCanSayONE - true to allow; false to block

    • setHumanCanSayONEToMachine

      public void setHumanCanSayONEToMachine(boolean humanCanSayONEToMachine)
      Configures if the human is allowed to call "UNO" on the machine.
      Parameters:
      humanCanSayONEToMachine - true to allow; false to block

    • setMachineSayOne

      public void setMachineSayOne(boolean machineSayOne)
      Records whether the machine has already called "UNO".
      Parameters:
      machineSayOne - true if already called; false otherwise

    • setPlayHuman

      public void setPlayHuman(boolean playHuman)
      Enables or disables the human's ability to play.
      Parameters:
      playHuman - true to allow human to play; false to restrict

    • setTurnLabel

      public void setTurnLabel(String text)
      Sets the text of the turn label in a thread-safe manner.
      Parameters:
      text - the text to display

    • isHumanCanSayONE

      public boolean isHumanCanSayONE()
      Returns:
      true if the human is allowed to call "UNO"; false otherwise

    • isHumanCanSayONEToMachine

      public boolean isHumanCanSayONEToMachine()
      Returns:
      true if the human can call "UNO" on the machine; false otherwise

    • isMachineSayOne

      public boolean isMachineSayOne()
      Returns:
      true if the machine has called "UNO"; false otherwise

    • isPlayHuman

      public boolean isPlayHuman()
      Returns:
      true if the human is currently allowed to play; false otherwise

    • setRunningOneThread

      public void setRunningOneThread(boolean runningOneThread)
      Enables or disables the UNO monitoring thread and forwards the state to it if present.
      Parameters:
      runningOneThread - true to keep it running; false to stop

    • setRunningPlayMachineThread

      public void setRunningPlayMachineThread(boolean runningPlayMachineThread)
      Enables or disables the machine play thread and forwards the state to it if present.
      Parameters:
      runningPlayMachineThread - true to keep it running; false to stop

    • isRunningOneThread

      public boolean isRunningOneThread()
      Returns:
      true if the UNO monitoring thread is marked as running; false otherwise

    • refreshGameView

      public void refreshGameView()
      Schedules a UI refresh of both hands and the turn label on the JavaFX thread.
